status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: This is a good one. Let me take a look. We should probably be hashing keys when they used as parts of filenames.

Strategy:

When creating file names use the ordered Base64 encoding that preserves lexical ordering, yet is both URL and filename safe.

This is a two way encoding so the starting row of a region can be determined from the region name and the file name of a region can be determined by the start key.
Many modifications required because region names (which contain start key) were used as file or directory names. Now the startKey is encoded in an order preserving Base64 dialect.

+1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12367975/patch.txt
against trunk revision r586003.
